column8: North-eastern N. America - Maine to Georgia, west to N. Dakota.
column16: Nabalus albus is a PERENNIAL growing to 1.5 m (5ft).  See above for USDA hardiness. It is hardy to UK zone 5.  It is in flower from July to August. The species is hermaphrodite (has both male and female organs) and is pollinated by Insects.  Suitable for: light (sandy), medium (loamy) and heavy (clay) soils and prefers  well-drained soil. Suitable pH: mildly acid and neutral soils. It can grow in full shade (deep woodland) or  semi-shade (light woodland). It prefers  moist soil.
column18: Woodland Garden Dappled Shade; Shady Edge; not Deep Shade;
column20: Antidote: Counters poisoning.,Diuretic: Acts on the kidneys, promoting the flow of urine.,Galactogogue: Promotes the flow of milk in a nursing mother.
column21: Plants For A Future can not take any responsibility for any adverse effects from the use of plants. Always seek advice from a professional before using a plant medicinally.Antidote  Diuretic  GalactogogueThe powdered root is sprinkled on food to stimulate milk flow after childbirth[222]. A tea made from the roots is used as a wash for weakness[222]. A latex in the stems is diuretic, it is used in female diseases[222]. It is also taken internally in the treatment of snakebite[222]. A poultice of the leaves or roots is applied to snakebites, dog bites etc[222].
column25: Succeeds in shade or semi-shade in a moist but well-drained humus-rich neutral to acid soil[200].
column26: Seed - surface sow in a greenhouse in spring. When they are large enough to handle, prick the seedlings out into individual pots and grow them on in the greenhouse for their first winter. Plant them out into their permanent positions in late spring or early summer, after the last expected frosts.
